column1: A wiki page for helper classes
column2: We have already more than five helper classes. They are not all in the same plug-in. And not every body is aware of their existance. For example I didn't know that there is a helper class named AccessControlHelper from which I can use isProjectAdmin() method  and I implemented this method myselef somewhere else.  I order to avoid such re-implementations I suggest to set-up a page in wiki in which all Helper classes are introduced. The second suggestion would be to move all helper classes to a unified place. AFAIK these are helper classes that we have: -UnicaseUiUtil -ModelUtil -ActionHelper -AccessControlHelper -OrgUnitHelper -ChangeTestHelper

column1: when scrolling in the me editor  usecase steps are blurred

column2: to sprint 13

ModelElementURLs (emfstore.esmodel  also see esmodel.ecore) are url ´s for model elements and consist of a serverurl  a projecturl fragement and a model element url fragement. URLFactory supports a method createModelElementUrl to create a url object from a string. All the above is already implemented. The missing part is a possibility to open model elements from a given url and to retrieve such a url. To retrieve a url a user can select to copy a url string from a model element into the clipboard. To open a url unicase registers i a url handler in the OS to handle the "unicas://" protocol. Opening such a url from a browser or an email will open unicase and open the model element in question if it is available in the local workspace or offer to checkout the project based on the serverurl given in the model element url.

column1: Disable the annotation context menu for meeting sections
column2: A lot of users get confused when adding workitems or issues to the according meeting sections and mistakingly choose to annotate them instead  of adding them. Maybe we should remove the annotation feature in the meeting section context menu  since annotations (if they are really wanted) can still be added using the MEEditor.

column1: EMFStore Browser: Show saved sessions only appropriate for selected server
column2: When selecting a server in the EMFStore Browser View and clicking right  only saved user sessions _for this server_ should be displayed. Whenever a new session  is created and there is already a saved session for this username and server  the old setting should be overwritten (maybe with a confirmation dialog).

Project name on the client independent of name on server
column2: A user cannot distinguish between multiple copies of the same project he has checked out (only if the differ in versions). Since we explicitly allow multiple checkouts it would be worth to think about a SVN like checkout scheme where the user can define a local name for the project and the projectname on the server appears as decorator to that name.

column1: Do we need an explicit CompositeSections collection under a Project?
column2: see related bug report.  Replay: No  we don't. I thought that we would need it for moving first level CompositeSection using dnd. But actually the original implementation of moving first level CompositeSection worked correctly. The problem that made me think it does not work was following:  First level CompositeSections are in containment reference ModelElements under a Project. Moving (changing index of) a ME in this collection is not a structural (containment) change  therefore it is not directly reflected in tree veiwer. For this change to be shown immidiately  one must call viewer.refresh().  This solved the problem.
column5: moving first level CompositeSections using DnD is not deterministic

column1: The ManageACOrgUnit Dialog allows creation of multiple version of a user
column2: In the ACUsers list a user can be added more than once  leading to erratic behaviour during login (only part of the projects of the user are shown  because the other part belongs to the "other" user).

There are numerous cases in which unicase can't handle strictly the given operation and tries the closest and most logical safety shot.  e.g. when you try to add a containment children to an element and this is not possible at the moment (whatever the cause may be)  they are included as children to the parent of the element - see the attached AI. This is fine as a workaround but there should be at least some kind of message saying what will be done.

There should be an entry in the project contextmenu to update to a specified revision  the entry is only available for admins. The user can enter an integer to update to. The Handler will build a primaryversionSpec from that an call the update() method on the projectspace.

column2: [Ubuntu] when i export a project  i have to enter a filename. Normally i just enter a name without a file extension like "test". Then the exported file is called "test". If i then want to import the project  the file cant be found  because the file selector is restricted to "*.ucp" or "*.*" which both dont match the filename "test"  Suggestsions: 1) add ".ucp" to the filename by default 2) suggest a filename like this by default: <project-name>@<revision_number>.ucp   Additionally  if i import the project  the project has the same name  like the filename  instead of the project name  of the exported project. I.e. i exported the project Dolli to the file test. Renamed it to test.ucp; imported it; -> the project is called "test.ucp(Not shared)"

column2: on the server  projectstates are in their own files now. using the everyXVersion functionality some projectstates are set to null  but the relating files aren't deleted yet. this side effect could be used to back up older projectstates without having them in the server's containment tree. you could  use everyXversion with a higher x value for the containment tree and save memory and have another x for deleting the projectstate files. Problem: if you want to use the backup you have to but it manually (xml file) into the containment tree
set for attribute should check if old and new value are identical if merging two of them same for multief add and remove  and ref set a=>b and ref set null b=>a

column1: Implement mapping from project to projectspace
column2: The Workspace must support a mapfrom project to projectspace. One INSTANCE! of a project cannot be in two projectspaces. The map must be build on init and must be maintained on checkout and delete. workspace supports a public getProjectSpaceMethod(Project project) to allow the ui to retrieve the projectspace for a project.

column1: Expand server in esbrowser shows exception.
column2: Expand collapse and expand a server  you get a assertion failed.  Resolution: This is actually a bug in the implementation of SWT. When you quickly try to collapse and expand (or vice versa) a node from a tree  an empty selection is returned. Resolved by checking if no element has been selected.

i do the following:  unicase is currently opened. I want to create a new worspace by doing the following: File -> Switch to Workspace -> "new workspace folder name"  - unicase (eclipse) closes and reopens using the new workspace. - i close the eclipse welcome screen - the java perspective is loaded and i can see the default unicase views: navigator  EMFStore Browser  Iteration Planing et. - i click on the Unicase tab in the left view part -> nothing happens.. no load symbol .. nothing - i click on the tab once more... then the tab in the viewpart disappears.   - I did some more investigations: - I switch to a newly created workspace and waited some time (> 10 seconds) then i clicked once on the navigator tab of the left view part and waited some time (> 5 seconds) - the navigator view appears  -> i think the loading of the navigator view takes some time  but the user doesnt know whats happening  becuase there is no loading symbol (mouse) or a progressbar. So the user probably reclicks on it and the view disappears (dunno why)    well.. not a big bug...

column1: [Search Projectwide] What can be searched through?
column2: sections  leafs  elements?

1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 List of questions: Where to locate GanttChart? Standalon plugin vs. part of unicase? How to open GanttChart? What are relevant WorkPackages? Multi selection of WorkPackages necessary? Read only GanttChart in the beginning? Is an extra tree view like in the examples necessary? Is an use case for the animation feature imaginable? Is there a plan for the implementation of optimization algorithms?
in ModelElement

set up gui testing with a gui testing framework   Jonas has previously experimented with a framework and has selected one based on his experience  ask him.   define tests for: navigator: create element and DND MEEditor: open model element  link element  change attribute Workspace commit  update

column1: Implement editing own comments if there is no reply
[Component diagram] Component semi circle is not well orientated

column2: Same issue as in the commit dialog.

column1: Decide a unit for the estimate property
column2: Currently the estimate property is just an int. We have to come up with a reasonable definition what this propertiy means. We could define it as days or hours for example or change its type to somthing more complicated.
The labels for the ServerInfos/ProjectInfos are sorted randomly - the ViewerSorter does not work properly due to an alternative implementation of the labelprovider.
the comments are usually context based and do not apply to other elements

column1: Some serialized elements on client side refer on server files (transport issue?)
column2: this probably caused by acuser in usersession

column1: Notification of changed "active project" doesn't occur when clicking on the project itself
column2: only when clicking children of the project (e.g. documents)

Please test all Views  add standard actions like "link with navigator   " add annotation"  delete and so on. Also consolidate where necessary. Test performance with all views  multiple instances and projects. Give direct feedback to us and helmut plz.
Creating a new StateDiagram leads to the following message:  Unable to open editor  unknown editor ID: org.unicase.ui.stateDiagram.part.ModelDiagramEditorID
shows changes on task witzh the description of the operation
The notification "drawer" should be expanded when clicking on the whole notification
- cannonizer - change recording start and stop: is start always called in any case after stop? - is save handled correctly on update - add check for non-project containment on commit

changes the containment references of a randomly selected model element. There are two variants:  1. simple: choses a random model element  if it has containments  finds its first containment reference  finds all model elements that mach this containment  and moves the first of these to that containment. 2. random: randomly selects a model element  if it has containments randomly selects one of its containments  randomly selects a model element that maches this containment  and moves the selected ME

column1: Should we implement a resolve Containment in add reference widget?
column2: When adding references to a model element there is an option "resolve containment". Selecting this option will collect all contained model elements of the requested type (type of the link e.g. orgunit) if any and add the containment children to the reference not the element itself. Known UseCase: Meeting - Participants reference  adding a group and checking the option would result in adding all group members instead of the group.

column1: Revision does not update in esbrowser
column2: When a local or remote user makes changes and commits  esborwser does not update the revision of project. This leads to a null pointer exception the next time one trys to check out the project. To solve the problem  user must first log out  and log in again so that the right revision number is shown in esbrowser. Now a check out can be performed.

column1: [Component diagram] Service nodes should (in the short run) not be resizable
column2: Resizing a service node results in service connector semi circles not properly fitting the service. As long as the service connectors do not resize accordingly  services should not be resizable. In general  services should only be resizable proportionally  so that they remain circles.

column2: In ProjectSpaceImpl there is a handleSetReference() method to create SingleReference operations and a handleEReference() method to create MultiReference operations. handleSetReference() method is called when notification has a SET event  and creates a SingleRefOperation.  handleEReference() method is called when notifaction has an ADD event  and creates a MultiReference operation.

column4: ChangesTReeComposite with Tabs and show details

column2: The DateTime widget displays the current system time instead of the time saved in the ModelElement.  This widget's behaviour is very magic ;)  if i change the time of a Date property  close the MEEditor and reopen it  the current system time is displayed in the widget. If i use the dropdown icon of the date widget  the time which has been saved in the modelElement is in the text part of the widget... But in the graphical display of the widget (the clock itself) displays the current system time. So if i close the widget again  the curent system time is saved ...  there is a lot more magic behavior in this widget ;)
with containment and widget in meeditor

Hints for class features in MEEditor
column2: As some meanings / usage scenarios of class features are not always obvious and can not be derived from the feature name there should be an explainatory tooltip for every feature  This is especially the case for multireference features as they don't indicate by their look which semantic meaning they have. In contrast to a simple attribute  which already gives you a hint by it's user interface element (Popup buttons  single line text fields  etc)

column1: The change package cannonizer is only executed on commit
column2: When you change a property of a ME and then manually restore its previous value  the operations cannonizer deletes both change operations. This happens only if a commit is initiated - i.e. otherwise the state of the project is still "dirty" and the user commits empty change packages.
including interface extension

column1: [Class Diagram] Attribute / method creation tool should work on entire edit part
column2: The creation tools by default only work when hovering over the respective edit part and parent edit part. It should also work on it's respective sibling as the 'location' of child edit part inside it's parent is well-defined.  As an example  the attribute creation tool only works on the attribute editpart and on the class editpart. It should also work on the method edit part.

column1: moving first level CompositeSections using DnD is not deterministic
column2: The reason is: Moving uses index of an element in its corresponding collection. For firs level CompositeSections this collection is modelElements() reference of Project  and it containes hundreds of elements. This way the index of firs level CompositeSection may not be sequential relating each other and in correspondence with the appereance order onder porject tree.

The attribute dueDate of a WorkItem should accept null as value and this should be the default. By containing a WorkItem into a WorkPackage the WorkItem should inherit the WorkPackages dueDate if it was not set previously .  A new validation rule should check that the dueDate of WorkItems cannot be later than the dueDate of the containing WorkPackage.

column1: Clarify Issue Matrix possibilities with Lars
resolveVersionSpec maybe can resolve a dateVersionSpec in another way
column2: If you set the date of the dateVersionSpec exceed or even equal to the date of the headVersion  then the dateVersionSpec can just be resolved to PrimaryVersionSpec 0  but not the nearest privous one you want to get. That's because when resolve a dateVersionSpec  it first looks for the nearest next version  then return the previous one  if you want to resolve a headVersion  there's nothing behind.

The task view user filter (first filter button) should not show tasks the user is the creator of but which are assigned to somebody else (and the user is not reviewer or participant in the task). The task view should only show the following: - Tasks the user created which are *not* assigned yet - Tasks the user is Assignee - Tasks the user is Reviewer and status "resolved" - Tasks the user is Participant  As a reminder - the resolved filter should show the resolved tasks of the user (where he is Assignee) when pressed  when not pressed  resolved tasks are not shown

column1: Deleted ActionItem remains in automatic Backlog
column2: Addition: Restarting Eclipse fixes the problem.  Steps to reproduce:  1. Add an ActionItem as an annotation to an element (e.g. the Project Management Doc). The item should show up in the Iteration Planning view under the automatic Backlog.  2. In the ActionItem's editor delete the newly generated ActionItem This will set the annotated m.e. and the assignee to N/A in the Iteration Planning view.  3. The deleted ActionItem remains in the Automatic Backlog.  4. If you now double click the according ActionItem in the IterationPlanning view  an error is thrown  because unicase tries to open the editor to the not existent model element.  5. Expected behavior: Either the ActionItem not being held in the AutoBacklog or a message explaining that the item was deleted and is only stored for some purpose. column1: Shortcut Alt-U does not correctly work on Mac OS X with English keyboard layout
column2: As Alt-U is the system wide shortcut for umlauts on Mac OS X when using an english/american keyboard Layout. Pressing Alt-U once is interpreted as umlaut dots  pressing twice results in Alt-Ü  which is then recognized as Alt-U by unicase and correctly brings up the update panel. Pressing Alt-U alone should also be recognized by unicase

Undo does not work in most places in unicase. column1: Show message on commit if no more changes to commit

a dnd operation on a child moving it from one parent to another should call setParent on the child not addChild on the new parent. For change tracking this results in an operation that is more readable.
It should be named "unicase" not "unicase perspective"

column1: Translate use cases to english please

column1: close the commit dialog on ctrl+enter
column2: the commit dialog should close on ctrl+enter  like every other dialog of this kind (e.g. svn commit). the behaviour is the same for all OS.  It's not neccessary that the user can configure the shortcut.
Some images make problems with decoration and in title of MEEditor.

column1: Remove the double-side linking with navigator
column2: It renders the context menu completely unusable !!!  steps to reproduce: 1. open a model element 2. try to open the context menu for another element in the navigator (e.g. new model element  or new annotation) 3. the editor jumps automatically to the new element -- if you have clicked on new element--- 4. the new model element editor is suppressed and sent to a background tab

You should be able to import GMF diagrams (e.g. from uml 2 tools) into unicase. That includes automatically creating the needed MEs (Classes  Packages  Associations  etc.) and acquiring the original layout.  Alternative: implement a generator to create unicase diagrams from ecore meta-models.
